description.p: All gods claim some aspects of creation as their domain and their devoted clerics work according to their gods’ definitive nature. But not all gods have interest in the created things. Some forces beyond the veil see all of the creation as weak and disgusting. There are gods that favor destruction of course, but destruction and chaos in itself is a “thing” at the end. But there are some beings that only crave the peace of the nothingness.

For the unsophisticated, these concepts may seem familiar by judging the results and methods of their followers. But the urge to kill is not the same as the craving of silence. These kinds of divine beings usually don’t get many followers among mortals, due to every creature’s essential desire to exist. However, there are cults consisting of nihilistic individuals. Some have hope for new beginnings after the total annihilation, some don’t even have that. They just believe existing causes pain and there is serenity in void.
You gain domain spells at the cleric levels listed in the Void Domain Spells table. See the Divine Domain class feature for how domain spells work.
When you choose this domain at 1st level, you gain the chill touch cantrip if you don’t already know it. This cantrip doesn’t count against the number of cleric cantrips you know.

Starting at 1st level, Death is not what you seek, but it is better than life. Dead things fades away much easier than anybodies imagination. When you deal necrotic damage to any creature by any means, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. This feature only works once per turn, on the first time you deal necrotic damage.

sheet.description: When you deal necrotic damage to any creature by any means, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. This feature only works once per turn, on the first time you deal necrotic damage.

element.name: Channel Divinity: Serenity of the Void

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to silence the most loud and changing voice of creation, magic.

As an action, you choose up to 4 creatures you can see within 30 feet of you. These chosen creatures are "blessed" with the serenity of the void and they can not cast any spells until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: Choose up to four creature you can see within 30ft, and "bless" them. The chosen creatures can not cast any spells until the end of your next turn.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, when a creature within 30 feet of you regains hit points by any magical means, you can use your reaction to block that life energy. Target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Spell Save DC or the target can not regain any hit points from that effect. Once you use this feature you can not use it again until you finish a short rest.

sheet.description: When a creature you can see within 30ft of you regains hit points by any magical means, abnegate that heal and disintegrate all its magical effects into particles by dematerializing them.

description.p: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip or necromancy spells.

sheet.description: Add {{wisdom:modifier}} to damage dealt with a cleric cantrip or necromancy spells.

description.p: At 17th level, your mere existence is unbearable for your enemies, reminding them of their insignificance. Whenever a creature hits you with a melee weapon or melee spell attack they are marked with the cold touch of the void. Their will to fight is broken. They have disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of their next turn.

sheet.description: Whenever a creature hits you with a melee weapon or melee spell attack, they will have disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of their next turn.
